name: ipsa tunisian blanket cal
notes:
> a free version of this pattern will be available on my [website][1].


> this pattern consists of a total of 30
> hexagons. i am unable to offer two
> versions of this pattern in ravelry
> but if you are interested in
> purchasing 20 hexagons for $19.99, you
> can [find the details on my
> website][2]. 


welcome to the tunisian blanket cal of 2024! this marks the fifth year of our blanket cal, and i'm thrilled to share this year's project with you.

for the 2024 cal, we'll be making 30 hexagons, each featuring a unique pattern. the cal will run from january 2nd to right before thanksgiving (see the full schedule below). throughout the cal, i'll be releasing patterns for all 30 hexagons, along with instructions for joining them and adding a border to the blanket.

i'm thrilled with how my blanket turned out, and i can't wait to see yours! i hope you're as excited about this cal as i am. let's make some beautiful blankets together!

january 9th - [hexagon #1][4]
january 23rd -[hexagon #2][5]
february 06th - [hexagon #3][6]
february 20th - [hexagon #4][7]

march 12th - [hexagon #5][9]
march 19th - [extension pack hexagon #2][10]
march 26th - [hexagon #6][11]
april 2nd - [extension pack hexagon #3][12]
april 9th - [hexagon #7][13]
april 16th - [extension pack hexagon #4][14]
april 23rd - [hexagon #8][15]
april 30th - [extension pack hexagon #5][16]
may 7th - [hexagon #9][17]
may 14th - [extension pack hexagon #6][18]
may 21st - [joining instructions][19]
may 28th - [hexagon #10][20]
june 4th - [extension pack hexagon #7][21]
june 11th - [hexagon #11][22]
june 18th - [extension pack hexagon #8][23]
june 25th - [hexagon #12][24]
july 9th - [extension pack hexagon #9][25]
july 16th - [hexagon #13][26]
august 6th - [extension pack hexagon #10][27]
august 20th - [hexagon #14][28]
september 3rd - [hexagon #15][29]
september 17th - [hexagon #16][30]

**what to expect in this pattern**
1. general instructions for the cal, including supplies needed and stitch tutorials.
2. written instructions for each hexagon.
3. a chart for each hexagon.
4. written instructions for the border.
5. support videos.

**technique and difficulty**
intermediate - you should be comfortable working in the round with a double-ended hook.

if you're new to tunisian-in-the-round, consider taking the course '[a beginner's guide to tunisian-in-the-round][36]' before starting this cal.

**size**
the size of the hexagons will depend on the yarn you picked. the measurements here are based on the gauge mentioned in the pattern. each hexagon has edges of size 8‚Äù (20 cms).

**yarn**
i made my blanket with knitpicks chroma fingering yarn in colors bare and vermont.

**hook**
for this blanket, i built a double-ended hook using two hooks: one size 5 mm (h-8) for the forward pass and another size 4.5 mm (7) for the return pass.

you could also use one with two hooks of the same size at both ends.

**facebook group**
join other participants and make your blankets together in my [knitterknotter hangout group on facebook][37]

**sharing on social media**
if you decide to share your projects on social media, i would love to see them! please tag your posts with **@knitterknotter #knitterknotter #knitterknottertunisianblanketcal2022** so that i can find them.

**blog**
you can find all my patterns on my blog here: 
https://knitterknotter.com/patterns/

please do not copy or redistribute this pattern. you may sell finished items but please credit the pattern to me: arunima goel @ knitterknotter.

you can follow me on my blog to get updates on new patterns: https://knitterknotter.com
